ygData.subject: Re: Blackened Iron Armor *SPOILER* (sort of)
ygData.msgSnippet: Sorry for not putting spoiler lines my last reply on this quest. So while I am still in shock at the value of this little item, the question I now put to all
ygData.messageBody:
Sorry for not putting spoiler lines my last reply on this quest. So while I
am still in shock at the value of this little item, the question I now put
to all you higher level bards than I is;

Do I keep it, or sell it and go on a crazy buying spree with the money?

I am an 11th lvl bard, currently using a Mino Axe, wearing a mix of leather,
ring and banded armor. The only magical items that I have beside the crown
is a pair of cuttthroat rings, and a goblin totem that gives me an extra
5hp. On the down side I only have a natural STR of 80 so even now I am
getting pretty close to being encumbered just by wearing some of the heavier
armor pieces.

I am interested to hear what some of the more experienced bards recommend.

thanks in advance,
Bernwyn

From: John Kim <kim@...>

Sent: Tuesday, July 20, 1999 1:54 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Blackened Iron Armor *SPOILER* (sort of)

> On Tue, 20 Jul 1999, scott brisko wrote:
> >
> > Okay on to more serious business. I completed the Ogre Head Quest in
> > Butcherblock last night by dropping off the heads of two named Ogres
> > (Corflunk and Zarcoomi) to Byzar Bloddforge in Kaladim. As a reward I
> > received a Blackened Iron Crown
> > (http://gameznet.com/eq/equipment/EQ-Blackened.Iron.Crown.html)
> >
> > which I thought was pretty nifty. This morning I was browsing Everlore
and
> > someone had remarked that this item had been sold at auction for 250pp.
I
> > just about passed out with dreams of avarice. Anyone have an idea if
this is
> > even near to being true? If so I am camping in BB for a while longer.
>
> You will occasionally get blackened iron items (armor only I
> think) for completing this quest. You just happened to hit
> the jackpot by getting the crown. IIRC it is +5 to all
> resists, and yes it's worth around 250pp. Normally you have
> to kill the goblin king in Runnyeye many times to get the
> crown (he usually drops the grotesque mask). Congratulations.
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
